page.title: 12EDUCATION IN CLUNBURY AREA
page.content: There are only two schools in the area, and both of those are primary schools, each with two teachers, one of whom is the head. Both schools were built over a{hundred years}ago and each has about{35}children aged{5}to {11.}The shool buildings are of stone, with windows set high up in the walls and both have outside toilets. { Clunbury}school has recently been fitted with electric night storage heaters. The{Parent Teacher {Associations}of the schools raise money to pay for extras such as{buses, {computers}and{field trips.}The children go swimming at{Bishop's {Castle}every week. Both schools had nearly 100 children 100 years ago. The local people are concerned that either or both schools may close and the children sent on a longer journey elswhere.{Clunbury}is church aided.
